result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus applicable costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Restitution set at ZERO.
Provide a DNA sample.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
Treatment and counseling programs, as determined by DOC Agent.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance Arnold Nehmer

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Restitution Determination (DOC-31, DOC-37)
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X   ]   Review / Modification Request / Recommended. Forwarded to Post Conviction.
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Sentencing proceeded. Court reviewed Character Reference Letters. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Operating privileges suspended for a period of TWO (2) YEARS. 
- Ignition interlock for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

-Restitution set at ZERO.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus applicable costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer in court with attorney Theodore R Rolfs.  Defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF1221. Discussion placed on the record. State placed final offer on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
Character Reference Documents and Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received and filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court, defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Branch 40 is down.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Sentencing Documents.

Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court, defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in Court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense requested a Plea and Sentencing hearing. Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer in court with Attorney Theodore R Rolfs; both appear by video.  Defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court, defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is housed at Red Granite; they don't have a computer available for the defendant to appear by video. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision level 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.

Defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer in court with attorney Theodore R Rolfs.  Defendant Lance Arnold Nehmer in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lance Arnold Nehmer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
